author: Simon Ejembi
title: Osinbajo meets Southern Kaduna religious, community leaders
text:
Tweet 
Acting President Yemi Osinbajo on Friday visited Kaduna State and held a meeting with religious and community leaders in Southern Kaduna. 
“It’s a first in a series of meetings I intend to hold with the community. Today’s meeting is just the beginning,” Osinbajo tweeted after the meeting. 
“I will return to meet each group separately and then meet all groups together again.” 
The Acting President commiserated with the families and relatives of all those who were killed in the violence that rocked the area and appealed for calm. 
He also thanked Governor Nasir El-Rufai for hosting the meeting at the Government House. I expressed condolence in person on behalf of the Buhari administration to all those who have lost lives. 
— Prof Yemi Osinbajo (@ProfOsinbajo) March 3, 2017 I also asked all to stop the bloodshed and let there be peace. 
— Prof Yemi Osinbajo (@ProfOsinbajo) March 3, 2017 
Osinbajo also inspected the Kaduna Airport where flights to Abuja would be rerouted to when the Nnamdi Azikiwe International Airport is closed for repairs on the runway.
